means: sleep ： 普通用词，指一般的睡眠。可用作引申指长眠或静止不动。
doze ： 多用于口语中，指轻微的小睡或处于半睡状态。
slumber ： 多指人安详地或长时间地睡。

sentence.Network_en: In one room, young mothers weave while babies doze in their laps.
sentence.Network_cn: 在一间屋子里，年轻的母亲们在织布，而她们的孩子就在她们膝上打盹。

sentence.Network_en: After lunch I had a doze.
sentence.Network_cn: 吃过午饭，我小睡了会儿。

sentence.Network_en: I had a doze on the train.
sentence.Network_cn: 我在火车上打了个盹儿。

jx.jx_en_mean: To fall into a light sleep.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (in the sense 'stupefy, bewilder, or make drowsy'): perhaps related to Danish døse 'make drowsy'

entry.def: When you doze, you sleep lightly or for a short period, especially during the daytime.

example.ex: For a while she dozed fitfully.

means.word_mean: 1. sleep lightly or for a short period of time

auth_sentence.content: We sit and doze, while they bicker and smooch.
auth_sentence.res_content: We sit and doze, while they bicker and smooch.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We sit and doze, while they bicker and smooch.

auth_sentence.content: I would fall into a doze, wake..., drowse again.
auth_sentence.res_content: I would fall into a doze, wake..., drowse again.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I would fall into a doze, wake..., drowse again.

auth_sentence.content: When very drunk it is permissible to fall into a light doze.
auth_sentence.res_content: When very drunk it is permissible to fall into a light doze.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: When very drunk it is permissible to fall into a light doze.

sentences.en: While the adults doze, the young play.
sentences.cn: 大人们在打瞌睡, 而孩子们在玩耍。

jushi.english: The old man dozed in his armchair.
jushi.chinese: 那个老人坐在扶手椅中打盹儿。
